concept.title: Student Personal Identification Number (PIN)
concept.shortdesc: All students are required to create a four-digit Personal Identification Number (PIN) in MyPack Portal in order to access student financial and academic records via phone.

section.title: What is a Student PIN?
section.p: A Student Personal Identification Number (PIN) is a new additional security measure that will allow some university offices to ensure compliance with the federal Family Education Rights and Privacy Act, or FERPA.

When helping students over the phone, this additional step will allow student services representatives and administrative officials to verify the identity of the caller by asking for the self-identified PIN that only the student should know.

ul.li: Office of Scholarships and Financial Aid

section.p: Students will be asked to provide their PIN when requesting access to FERPA-protected information.

section.title: Effective Date
section.p: The new Student PIN verification will be available to students in MyPack Portal beginning in March 2021. However, students will not be required to input a Student PIN until the Fall 2021 semester.
